details.title: Know the key players in Jharkhand
details.content: Two of the key contestants in this state elections are BJP and Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM)-led Opposition alliance. BJP, which had won 37 seats in the last elections, coined the slogan "Abki baar 65 paar". However, it is facing a stiff challenge as the alliance of JMM, Congress and Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) seems to have an advantage, as per exit polls released last week.

details.title: Roles of AJSU, JVM-P can be crucial too
details.content: Apart from BJP, Congress and RJD, AJSU and Jharkhand Vikas Morcha-Prajatantrik (JVM-P) are also playing equally important role in the tribal-dominated state.

details.title: Quick flashback of 2014 elections
details.content: Raghubar Das took oath as Chief Minister in 2014 as BJP won 37 seats and stitched an alliance with the AJSU, which got 5 seats. However, AJSU broke ties with BJP this time around and contested polls solo this time. While the ruling party has fielded its candidates in 79 out of the 81 seats, it has not fielded any candidate against AJSU's Sudesh Mahto, and has supported a candidate in the remaining one constituency.

details.title: Latest visuals from Dumka
details.content:
Jharkhand: Counting of votes for #JharkhandAssemblyPolls to take place today. Visuals from a counting centre in Dumka. pic.twitter.com/Sxe1eQpbeB

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019

details.title: Counting of votes begins
details.content: Counting of votes for the 81 Assembly seats begin.

details.title: Posters supporting Opposition grand alliance come up in Ranchi
details.content:
Jharkhand: Poster with 'Jharkhand ki pukar hai gathbandhan ki sarkar hai. Hemant ab ki baar hai' seen in Ranchi. Counting of votes for #JharkhandAssemblyPolls begins at 8 am today. pic.twitter.com/903QC3Q9iC

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019

details.title: What the exit polls are predicting
details.content: According to the ABP/C-Voter exit poll, JMM, Congress and RJD will retain 35 seats. It has, however, given 32 seats to the ruling BJP, 5 to AJSU and three to the Jharkhand Vikas Morcha (Prajatantrik) and six to others. India Today-Axis My India shows that the BJP is going to trail behind the Congress. It has given JMM-led opposition between 38 and 50 seats and the BJP between 22 and 32 seats. It has predicted 3 to 5 seats for the AJSU, 2 to 4 seats for the JVM-P, and 4 to 7 seats to others.

details.title: How JMM-Congress performed in 2014
details.content: JMM won 17 seats, while its current ally Congress bagged six seats.

details.title: Raghubar Das, Hemant Soren face tough fights
details.content: Raghubar Das is contesting from the Jamshedpur East seat against his ex-cabinet colleague Saryu Rai, who is fighting as an independent, and Congress candidate Gourav Vallabh. Former Chief Minister Hemant Soren is the fray from two seats -- Dumka and Barhet. BJP has pitted Women and Child Development Minister Louis Marandi in Dumka against Soren.

details.title: Visuals from Ranchi
details.content:
Jharkhand: Counting of votes for all 81 assembly constituencies of the state is underway. Visuals from a counting centre in Ranchi. #JharkhandAssemblyPolls pic.twitter.com/KXtHBu6dr8

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019

details.title: Hemant Soren leading in Dumka, Barhait seats
details.content: JMM chief Hemant Soren is leading in Barhait and Dumka Assembly seats. He is contesting against Woman and Child Welfare minister Louis Marandi of the BJP in Dumka and in Barhait, his main opponent is BJP's Simon Malto. In 2014 polls, Soren won from the Rajmahal constituency.

details.title: Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das leading in Jamshedpur East constituency
details.content: Das, who is leading at the Jamshedpur East seat, has been winning from it since 1995. This time he faces a contest from ex-cabinet colleague Saryu Rai, who is fighting the polls as an independent candidate.

details.title: AJSU chief leading from Silli
details.content: AJSU Chief Sudesh Mahto also leading from Silli seat.

details.title: Jharkhand Congress chief takes early lead in his constituency
details.content: Congress Chief Rameshwar Oraon is leading from Lohardaga.

details.title: AJSU leading in Gomia Constituency
details.content: Party candidate Lambodar Mahto leads over Babita Devi of JMM by 2,217 votes in Gomia seat.

details.title: Jharkhand CM now trailing in his constituency
details.content: Chief Minister Raghubar Das trailing in Jamshedpur East.

details.title: Babulal Marandi leads in his constituency
details.content: The former Jharkhand CM and chief of JVM (P) is leading in Dhanwar seat.

details.title: RJD candidate leads in Godda seat
details.content: Sanjay Prasad Yadav of RJD leads over Amit Kumar Mandal of BJP by 3,315 votes in Godda constituency.

details.title: Hemant Soren trails in Dumka
details.content: At the end of first round, BJP's Louis Marandi takes a lead of 3209 votes against the JMM chief.

details.title: BJP leads in Potka constituency
details.content: Menka Sardar of BJP leads over JMM's Sanjib Sardar by 5,144 votes in Potka seat.

details.title: Jharkhand CM regains lead in his constituency
details.content: Raghubar Das leading by 342 votes, independent candidate Saryu Rai trailing.

details.title: Hemant Soren leads in Barhait constituency
details.content: The JMM chief is leading by 664 votes against BJP's Simon Malto. In Dumka, Soren is trailing against BJP's Louis Marandi by 6329 votes

details.title: Babalal Marandi leading in Dhanwar
details.content: The former Jharkhand CM and JVM(P) leader is ahead by 2841 votes in Dhanwar. His opponent and CPI(ML) candidate Raj Kumar Yadav is trailing there.

details.title: Tejashwi Yadav's first reaction on the Jharkhand trends
details.content:
Tejashwi Yadav, RJD: There is going to be a clean sweep for Mahagathbandhan (grand alliance) in this election. We have fought elections under leadership of Hemant Soren. He is going to be the Chief Minister. #JharkhandAssemblyPolls pic.twitter.com/EyjkwkTJ8n

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019

details.title: JVM chief Babulal Marandi reacts on the Jharkhand developments
details.content: "We were with the people, we are and we will be with the people of this State. Our role will be the same as it was earlier in this State. Results are not as we expected, but we respect the mandate given by the people," Marandi said on Monday.

details.title: Babulal Marandi maintains a steady lead
details.content: The JVM chief is leading from Dhanwar seat by 2841 votes.

details.title: Too early to jump into any decision: AJSU
details.content: AJSU Spokesperson Deosharan Bhagat said, "These are the early trends. Since, contest on most of the seats are triangular or quadrangular, trends will keep on changing till last round. It will be too early to jump on any decision."

details.title: Update from Silli constituency
details.content: AJSU party's Sudesh Mahto trailing in Silli seat, JMM's Seema Devi leading by 284 votes.

details.title: Updates on Raghubar Das, Hemant Soren's poll performance so far
details.content: Jharkhand CM and BJP candidate from Jamshedpur East, Raghubar Das, leading by 1449 votes. JMM's Hemant Soren leading from Barhait seat by 5319 votes and trailing from Dumka seat by 5381 votes.

details.title: JVM(P) chief maintains steady lead in his constituency
details.content: Babulal Marandi leading from Dhanwar seat by 5980 votes.

details.title: Sudesh Mahto leads in Silli seat
details.content: AJSU Chief Sudesh Mahto leading from Silli with 4278 votes in fourth round.

details.title: We will form government under BJP leadership: CM Raghubar Das
details.content: "These trends are not the final word. There are more rounds of counting to be held. It will not be correct to comment on these trends. I will hold a press conference later in Ranchi.Had Saryu Rai caused damage, I would not have received the votes, which I did so far. Let me clearly state that we're not only winning but we'll also form govt under the leadership of BJP in the state", Das said.

details.title: BJP leader Shivraj Singh Chouhan reacts on the Jharkhand trends
details.content:
Shivraj Singh Chouhan, BJP in Jaipur on being asked if BJP trails in #JhakhandAssemblyPolls, will it be a litmus test for #CAA: No such question arises. State elections are fought on issues concerning the state. pic.twitter.com/7narC5Y8Jp

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019

details.title: Were confident about getting clear majority: RPN Singh
details.content: "We were confident that Jharkhand will give clear majority to our alliance. Trends are good but I won't make comment until final result.We've clearly said that Hemant Soren will be CM candidate of our alliance," said the Jharkhand Congress in-charge.

details.title: Hemant Soren now leads in both of his seats
details.content: The JMM leader is leading from Dumka seat by 2463 votes and Barhait by 8616 votes.

details.title: Scenes of celebration at Jharkhand Congress camp
Appears like BJP has lost: Saryu Roy
details.content: “As per the trends, it appears that BJP has lost in Jharkhand. But, still everything depends on the last tally after the counting is over on all seats.” When asked about his role in the next government, Roy said that his role will be neutral. “I will support a decision which is in the interest of the people of this State and will not give a second thought to oppose if it is not in the interest of the people,” Roy said.

details.title: AJSU Chief leading in Silli constituency
details.content: Sudesh Mahto leading with 10400 votes in Silli against JMM candidate Seema Mahto.

details.title: Roy leads against Raghubar Das
details.content: Saryu Roy leading with 771 votes against Jharkhand Chief Minister and BJP leader Raghubar Das from Jamshedpur East constituency.

details.title: Visuals from the JMM camp
Only local issues matter in Jharkhand: JMM
details.content: “Government of lies has been given befitting reply by the people of Jharkhand by giving a clear majority to the Opposition alliance. BJP was talking about 65-plus, but national issues like Ram Mandir, Triple Talaq and NRC are irrelevant as only the local issues like poverty, unemployment, education and the problems being faced by farmers matter in Jharkhand,” JMM General Secretary Supriyo Bhattacharya said.

details.title: Congress wins Bermo
details.content: Party candidate Rajendra Singh registered a victory from the Bermo constituency.

details.title: RJD gains massively in Jharkhand
details.content: Rashtriya Janta Dal, which had won only one seat in 2014 Assembly elections, seems to be gaining the most this time around as the party has been maintaining a consisting leads in five seats. RJD is also one of the partners of the Opposition alliance formed by the JMM and Congress. RJD is leading in Chatra, Chhattarpur, Koderma, Godda and Deoghar.

details.title: Raghubar Das trails in Jamshedpur East, AJSU wins Gomia
details.content: While BJP dissident Saryu Roy leading with 4643 votes against Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das in Jamshedpur East, Lambodar Mahto of AJSU wins from Gomia constituency.

details.title: Who is Saryu Roy?
details.content: Roy, largely known for his differences with Chief Minister Raghubar Das, took a decision to challenge him at his home turf as an independent candidate after he was denied ticket by BJP. Das has been winning from Jamshedpur (East) for the last five consecutive terms, while Roy has been representing Jamshedpur (West) for the last three terms.

details.title: BJP wins Chandankiyari
details.content: Amar Bauri of BJP wins from Chandankiyari.

Saryu Rai, independent candidate from Jamshedpur East, leading against Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das says, "Lead of about 1500-2000 will continue in the coming rounds of counting. I could win by a margin of 30,000 votes."

details.title: Congress-JMM-RJD alliance leading on 40 seats
details.content: As per official Election Commission trends, BJP is currently leading on 31 seats and Congress-JMM-RJD alliance on 40 seats. (JMM 23, Congress 13 and RJD 4)

details.title: Hemant Soren leading in Barhait, trailing in Dumka
details.content:
JMM's Hemant Soren is trailing on Dumka seat by 461 votes and leading on Barhait by 9948 votes. (file pic) #JharkhandElection2019 pic.twitter.com/2cKp2BAFia

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019

details.title: Raghubar Das continues to trail on Jamshedpur East
details.content: Jharkhand CM and BJP candidate from Jamshedpur East, Raghubar Das, still trailing. Independent candidate Saryu Rai is leading by 4643 votes.

details.title: BJP wins Khunti
details.content: Neelkanth Singh Munda of BJP declared winner from Khunti Assembly seat.

details.title: JMM's Hemant Soren leading from Barhait and Dumka
details.content: JMM's Hemant Soren is leading from Barhait assembly constituency by margin of 11668 votes and from Dumka seat by 2750 votes.

Counting of votes for #JharkhandAssemblyPolls is underway. As per official Election Commission trends, BJP is currently leading on 24 seats and Congress-JMM-RJD alliance on 46 seats (JMM 29, Congress 14 and RJD 3) pic.twitter.com/gYJThEIeWO

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019

details.title: Hemant Soren wins from Barhait
details.content: JMM Executive President Hemant Soren wins from Barhait
CPI (ML) candidate Binod Singh wins from Bagodar.

details.title: 'BJP will accept people's mandate'
details.content: Jharkhand CM and BJP candidate from Jamshedpur East, Raghubar Das: I am hopeful that result will be in our favour. I am waiting for the final results. BJP will accept the people's mandate.

details.title: Jharkhand election latest results
details.content:
• AJSU Chief Sudesh Mahto wins from Silli.
  • CPI (ML) candidate Binod Singh wins from Bagodar.
  • Congress Chief Rameshwar Oraon wins Lohardaga
  • Congress candidate Amba Prasad wins from Badkagaon

details.title: Hemant Soren set to become next Jharkhand CM
details.content:
#WATCH: Jharkhand Mukti Morcha's (JMM) Hemant Soren rides a cycle at his residence in Ranchi. JMM is currently leading on 28 seats while the Congress-JMM-RJD alliance is leading on 46 seats. pic.twitter.com/e9HYcb26Y2

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019

Hemant Soren, Jharkhand Mukti Morcha's (JMM) in Ranchi: I am thankful to the people of Jharkhand for the mandate. pic.twitter.com/mP23eLPNbw

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019

details.title: All opposition partners will meet to "strategize the future course of action": Hemant Soren
details.content:
Hemant Soren, the chief ministerial candidate of the opposition alliance, which is on way to a decisive victory over the ruling BJP, Monday said the people of Jharkhand have given a clear majority to the JMM/ Congress/ RJD combine. 

(READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: People are with non-BJP states: Sharad Pawar
details.content: The result of Jharkhand Assembly Polls that has come today clearly states that people are with non-BJP parties. After Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh and Maharashtra, people have decided to keep BJP away from power in Jharkhand also, says NCP chief Sharad Pawar.

details.title: BJP will continue to stay committed towards development in Jharkhand: Amit Shah
details.content:
हम झारखंड की जनता द्वारा दिये गये जनादेश का सम्मान करते हैं।

भाजपा को 5 वर्षों तक प्रदेश की सेवा करने का जो मौका दिया था उसके लिए हम जनता का हृदय से आभार व्यक्त करते हैं। भाजपा निरंतर प्रदेश के विकास के लिए कटिबद्ध रहेगी।

सभी कार्यकर्ताओं का उनके अथक परिश्रम के लिए अभिनंदन।

— Amit Shah (@AmitShah) December 23, 2019

details.title: Dented in Haryana, denied in Maharashtra, defeated in Jharkhand: Chidambaram on poll result
details.content:
Former union minister P Chidambaram on Monday thanked the voters of Jharkhand for siding with the coalition of the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM), Congress and Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) and added that the election results have shown that the BJP is "slipping" nationwide.


(READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: It's my defeat, not of BJP: Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das
details.content:
As per the latest trends available on the Election Commission website, Das was trailing BJP rebel candidate and former minister Saryu Roy by over 10,000 votes in Jamshedpur (East) constituency.

(READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Jharkhand rejected misleading politics of Modi-Shah: Gehlot
details.content:
The people of Jharkhand were unhappy and everyone knew that the Congress is going to win. They pressed their entire resources into use in Jharkhand but the message of Sonia Gandhi went to the people. The way in which they are misleading the people, even Prime Minister Narendra Modi misled the people from Ramlila Maidan, but we got a clear mandate in Jharkhand, said Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot

(READ FULL STORY)

details.title: Jharkhand BJP chief loses Chakradharpur
details.content: State BJP President Laxman Gilua also loses from his seat in Chakradharpur.

details.title: PM congratulates Hemant Soren
details.content:
Congratulations to @HemantSorenJMM Ji and the JMM-led alliance for the victory in the Jharkhand polls. Best wishes to them in serving the state.

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) December 23, 2019

details.title: PM thanks people of Jharkhand
details.content:
I thank the people of Jharkhand for having given @BJP4India the opportunity to serve the state for many years. I also applaud the hardworking Party Karyakartas for their efforts.

We will continue serving the state and raising people-centric issues in the times to come.

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) December 23, 2019
Congress candidate from Jamshedpur West Assembly constituency Banna Gupta celebrates his victory along with his supporters in Jamshedpur. (Photo | PTI)
Hemant Soren wins Dumka assembly constituency by margin of 13188 votes & Barhait assembly constituency by margin of 25740 votes.

details.title: Raghubar Das to resign
details.content: CM Raghubar Das reaches Raj Bhawan to hand over his resignation to Governor Droupadi Murmu.

#JharkhandAssemblyElections2019: Chief Minister Raghubar Das tenders his resignation from the post to Governor Draupadi Murmu, at Raj Bhavan in Ranchi. pic.twitter.com/Dk1PChjZ39

— ANI (@ANI) December 23, 2019
